availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Odor (Harrison County, KY, farmer and carpenter )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Phoebe Odor. Father of Ellen Odor, Ephraim Odor, and Cordelia Odor. Carpenter with William Odor in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Employed Man Ostin as a farmhand in Harrison County in 1860. Farmer in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 57A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 496.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 181.
